region.  This seaside community is often called Point Pleasant by tourists. In fact Point Pleasant Beach, a coastal town that sees a large influx of summer visitors, is a separate political entity from its western neighbor -

Travel South along the Garden State Parkway until Exit 98.  Follow Rt. 34 South until it becomes Rt. 35 South and follow it over the bridge.  Make a left at Arnold Avenue (3rd light) and follow signs to your destination.
Take Garden State Parkway Exit 88. Proceed to Rt 70 (About 3 miles) Make Left on Rt 70 and proceed to Rt 35 South (About. 7 miles).
Take NJ Turnpike to exit 7a for Rt 195 East. Proceed to East to Exit 35A (Brielle). for Rt. 34 South. Follow directions above from 34.

value: +1 973 961-6000, fax +1 973 961-6259. Major airport with restaurants, shops on-site.
+1 609 645-7895. Small airport usually used by those within the Atlantic County area.

Point Pleasant Beaches' attractions are all confined to one area and are all within walking distance to each other.  Walking is a good option especially in the months of May-September when tourist season is at its peak and finding parking can be difficult. The boardwalk includes a residential stretch perfect for a quiet and scenic evening stroll.

It is common to see residents and tourists riding their bikes along the boardwalk during the summer months.  Bikes are also ridden within the town to and from various destinations.  Bikes and surray bikes are available for rent on the boardwalk for those who do not bring their own. It is a great option if you are looking to get exercise and transportation  at the same time.

Rent a Car if you are planning on traveling outside of Point Pleasant Beach or seeing other destinations than the beach or boardwalk.  If you are planning on driving to the beach be prepared to pay for parking or walk if you prefer the free parking on the streets.

. These are used at night by those who take advantage of the bar scene, or used by those who are in a real rush and do not have a car nearby.

value: content=Air-conditioned aquarium with extensive variety of sea creatures, hands-on workshops for kids.
content=Two mini-golf courses; one goes down to the caves of the cove and through waterfalls, the other goes outside and on top of the course giving a perfect aerial view of the boardwalk and beach.
Àê "The Wall" at the Manasquan Inlet is the point where the Atlantic meets the Manasquan River, and an excellent place to fish year round.

content=Along the side of the beach; arcades, snack shacks, games, mini-golf. Jenkinson's Pavilion Arcade & Fun House offers a variety of games and prizes as well as a crazy fun house full of trick mirrors and mazes. Jenkinson's Amusement Rides offers rides for all ages: a carousel, convoy race, crazy bus, dizzy dragons, and a train that goes around the whole perimeter of the park for younger kids; swings, bumper cars, starship, tilt-a-whirl, Moby Dick, twister, tornado, super Himalaya and a rock wall for older kids and adults. The park opens noon daily, end of May to early September. Ticket prices vary; on wristband days, unlimited access to the rides is $15 dollars a person.
content=Be adventurous and see the sights from up in the air.
content=Public beaches with scenic view of the Jersey Shore. From Memorial Day through Labor Day, season badges or daytime passes can be purchased for a fee and lifeguards are on duty 9-5 daily.
content=A sailboat which sails year-round, offering fishing trips. Galley serves hamburgers, soda, coffee and tea. Music and television on board. Free parking at dock.
content=Sailboat that can be rented for anything from birthday cruises, fireworks cruises, marriage ceremonies, class reunions and holiday parties to fishing expeditions.
content=Point Pleasant Beach visitors and residents showcase all the talent they have.
content=A magnificent fireworks display right on the boardwalk after sunset.
content=Watch different performances from live bands every week.
content=Annual end of summer bash with shopping and seafood from local restaurants. Crab cakes, shrimp skewers and lobster; hundreds of craft vendors.
content=All the equipment for a day of fishing by the sea.
content=Fishermen's store, supplies and equipment, bait, fuel, ice and tackle.
content=Salt water taffy, caramel and candy apples, homemade fudge.
content=One of fifteen shops and antique stores in Point Pleasant's Antique Emporium. Treasures of the past, local memorabilia to world-renown items and artifacts.
content=Old time candy shoppe right on the boardwalk featuring delicious hand-made chocolates, fudge, and salt water taffy
content= Shop/workshop specializing in hand crafted, wood carved items that are unique and rustic.
content=Small beach bar on the boardwalk. Cheesesteaks, hot dogs, French fries. Frozen drinks or cocktails at any time of day.
content=Pizza, burgers and chicken fingers. Sushi and raw bar. Deli counter. Can get very crowded during the summer months.
content=Fresh thin crust pizza on the Jenkinson's Boardwalk, by the slice or pie.
content=Salads, burgers, wraps, steak and seafood.  Restaurant indoors, Tiki Bar outside, wide range of American food and specials. Popular but can be on the pricey side.
content=Everything from gravy fries and Taylor ham to burgers and Italian specialties. Breakfast.
content=Casual. Seafood, sandwiches, burgers, open year round.
content=Fresh seafood delivered daily from local ships. Pricey, but worth the money.
content=Italian. Steak, pasta, pizza.  Dining in the steak & chop house and a more casual eatery with Joe Spano's Tomato Pies. Hall rental for parties and special occasions.
in a surf shack-like setting, salsa bar, Tsunami food challenge.
content=Over 40 beer selections. Appetizer menu includes nachos, wings and mozzarella sticks. Party room for up to 70 people.
content=Seafood, burgers, salads, full bar, live performances, happy hours, a meal at any time for over-21 crowd.

This listing covers just Point Pleasant Beach. See
for additional options in Wall, South Wall and Point Pleasant.

content=Resort on private stretch of Point Pleasant Beach, indoor heated swimming pool, two outdoor pools, Firefly Restaurant, fitness centre, banquet and conference facilities. Sea Spa and Salon (+1 732-714-1220) is a relaxing, full service spa offering Zen envelopment treatment, aromatherapy treatment and everything from manicures and pedicures to hair design.
content=Dining room, outdoor pool, wired Internet, continental breakfast served on patio. No pets allowed. Overlooks Jenkinson's boardwalk.
content=Fifty room Jersey Shore motel, outdoor pool. No pets allowed, must be 21 years or older to rent.
content=Pool, continental breakfast, two blocks from beach and boardwalk. Single and double rooms, suites.
content=By the ocean, parallel to the beach. Outdoor pool, free parking, shuttle service to the boardwalk.
content=No visitors, no pets. Refrigerators. Outdoor pool 9AM-7PM. A few blocks away from the beach.

content=Outdoor pool, wi-fi, refrigerators in rooms. Small family owned and operated motel on the north end of town; the Bilotti family grew up vacationing in Point Pleasant Beach and decided to purchase a house and motel there. Three blocks from beach, boardwalk and Manasquan inlet; suited for families and children.

content=A restored Queen Anne Victorian Bed and Breakfast Inn. Geared more towards couples and business travelers than to families, the inn bills itself as a romantic getaway spot with beautifully decorated rooms.
content=Main house and carriage house for weekly/monthly rental.
